name: coquetry
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
behaviour in which someone tries to attract attention by pretending to be sexually interested in people, in a pleasant but not serious way: She often resorts to girlish coquetry to get her way. See
coquette
More examplesFewer examplesBecause he is handsome and polite, they sometimes respond to his flirting with coquetry of their own. Any attempts at coquetry on her part met with an irritated frown on his. Annie Moffat's foolish lessons in coquetry came into her mind.Her coquetry intimidates some men.
